item.title: 数据显示，2025 年全球政府发行的美元债务将大幅下降
item.description: 亚洲和欧洲各国政府以美元举债的情况比往常少得多，它们更倾向于在国内发行，以避免受到美国收益率上升、货币波动以及对美国政府财政的更广泛担忧的影响。【原文：Governments in Asia and Europe are raising far less debt in U.S. dollars than usual, preferring to issue at home as they avoid exposure to rising U.S. yields, currency volatility and broader concerns about U.S. government finances.】

item.title: 尼尔森智库（NielsenIQ）称，尽管受到网络攻击，M&S食品销售仍表现出韧性
item.description: 英国零售商玛莎百货公司（Marks & Spencer）周四公布的行业数据显示，尽管上个月的网络攻击影响了食品供应，但该公司的食品业务在截至5月17日的12周内销售额同比增长了10.8%。【原文：British retailer Marks & Spencer's food business saw food sales increase 10.8% over the 12 weeks to May 17 year-on-year despite the fallout from a cyberattack last month denting availability, industry data showed on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国法院的关税裁决给市场带来短期刺激和长期忧虑
item.description: 周四，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的全面关税政策在法律上遇到了障碍，这引起了市场的欢呼，但长期政策和经济瘫痪的风险给担心长远发展的投资者投下了更深的阴影。【原文：A legal roadblock on U.S. President Donald Trump's sweeping tariffs drew early cheer from markets on Thursday, but the risks of extended policy and economic paralysis cast a deeper shadow for investors worried about the longer term.】

item.title: 马斯克：特斯拉将于 6 月交付首款自动驾驶汽车 Model Y
item.description: 特斯拉首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）周四表示，特斯拉将于 6 月交付首辆自动驾驶汽车 Model Y。【原文：Tesla will deliver its first self-driving Model Y car in June, CEO Elon Musk said on Thursday.】

item.title: 谷歌开始在印度在线直销 Pixel 手机
item.description: 周四，谷歌开始在印度直接在线销售其流行的硬件设备，包括 Pixel 手机、手表和耳塞，在此之前，谷歌预计将在这个南亚国家开设首家实体店。【原文：Google on Thursday began direct online sales of its popular hardware devices in India, including Pixel phones, watches and earbuds, ahead of an anticipated launch of its first physical stores in the South Asian nation.】

item.title: 市场询问新日铁多久能从美国钢铁公司 150 亿美元的竞购中获益
item.description: 新日铁的投资者和分析师们都在问，新日铁斥资 150 亿美元收购美国钢铁公司的交易虽然得到了美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的支持，但尚未获得其批准。【原文：Nippon Steel investors and analysts are asking if its $15-billion deal to buy U.S. Steel , backed but not yet approved by President Donald Trump, is positive for the near term, even if its hopes for strong U.S. demand materialise.】

item.title: 出口商称韩国对美国的贸易顺差将缩小
item.description: 韩国最大的出口商集团周四表示，随着企业继续投资美国市场，韩国对美贸易顺差将逐步收窄，创下历史新高。【原文：South Korea's record-high trade surpluses with the United States will gradually narrow as companies continue to invest in the U.S. market, the country's biggest exporter group said on Thursday.】

item.title: 韩国银行认为汽车、钢铁和芯片出口将因关税影响而下降
item.description: 韩国央行周四表示，随着美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的关税影响在今年晚些时候生效，韩国的汽车、钢铁和半导体出口预计将下降。【原文：South Korea's exports of automobiles, steel and semiconductors are expected to fall as the impact of U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs take effect later this year, the central bank said on Thursday.】

item.title: 欧洲 市场希望特朗普关税保持 "非法 "状态
item.description: 韦恩-科尔对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Wayne Cole】

item.title: 丰田汽车 4 月份全球产销量连续第四个月增长
item.description: 丰田公司周四表示，由于混合动力汽车需求强劲以及美国总统唐纳德-特朗普征收进口关税引发的美国抢购潮，该公司4月份的全球产销量连续第四个月增长。【原文：Toyota said on Thursday its worldwide output and sales rose for a fourth consecutive month in April on strong demand for hybrid vehicles and rush buying in the United States over U.S. President Donald Trump's import tariffs.】

item.title: 中美解冻、贸易协议震荡美元，亚洲货币看涨押注激增 - 路透社调查
item.description: 路透社周四的一项民意调查显示，由于中美关税紧张局势的缓解、新贸易协议的达成以及对美国政策日益增长的不安促使投资者撤出美元资产，投资者对包括人民币在内的亚洲货币下了大量看涨赌注。【原文：Investors piled up bullish bets on Asian currencies, including the yuan, as easing U.S.-China tariff tensions, new trade deals and a growing unease with U.S. policies prompted them to pull out of dollar assets, a Reuters poll showed on Thursday.】

item.title: 据当地媒体报道，华东地区大型比亚迪经销商倒闭
item.description: 据国有媒体报道，中国电动汽车制造商比亚迪（BYD）在山东省东部的一家大型国Ⅳ汽车经销商已经倒闭，至少有20家门店荒废或关闭。【原文：A large dealer of Chinese electric vehicle maker BYD's , cars in the eastern province of Shandong has gone out of business with at least 20 of its stores found to be deserted or shut, government-owned media reported.】

item.title: 富士康董事长表示，富士康很快将宣布另一个日本汽车合作伙伴
item.description: 台湾富士康董事长刘永好周四表示，富士康将很快宣布另一个日本汽车合作伙伴。【原文：Taiwan's Foxconn will soon announce another Japanese auto partner, Chairman Young Liu said on Thursday.】

item.title: 英伟达披露更多中国风险，但首席执行官称赞特朗普
item.description: 尽管本周三英伟达公司（Nvidia）又公布了一份销售额增长69%的业绩报告，但这家人工智能芯片制造商警告说，中美之间的技术冲突将给其业务带来更多风险。【原文：Even as Nvidia reported another blockbuster quarter of 69% sales growth on Wednesday, the maker of artificial intelligence chips warned of more risks to its business emerging in the technology conflict between the U.S. and China.】

item.title: 中国 DeepSeek 发布 R1 推理模型升级版
item.description: 周四凌晨，中国人工智能初创公司 DeepSeek 发布了其 R1 推理模型的更新版本，加强了与 OpenAI 等美国竞争对手的竞争。【原文：Chinese artificial intelligence startup DeepSeek released an update to its R1 reasoning model in the early hours of Thursday, stepping up competition with U.S. rivals such as OpenAI.】

item.title: 朝日新闻》称，特朗普政府要求日本提高美军费用分摊比例
item.description: 朝日新闻》（Asahi Shimbun）周四援引政府消息来源报道称，特朗普政府在 5 月初要求日本增加对驻日美军的费用分摊，这促使东京考虑将设施资金增加数百亿日元。【原文：The Trump administration asked Japan in early May to increase its share of costs for U.S. troops stationed there, prompting Tokyo to consider boosting facility funding by tens of billions of yen, the Asahi Shimbun reported on Thursday, citing government sources.】

item.title: 美国法院阻止特朗普加征关税，油价攀升
item.description: 在美国法院阻止唐纳德-特朗普总统的关税措施生效后，油价周四上涨，同时市场还在关注美国可能采取新的制裁措施遏制俄罗斯原油流动，以及欧佩克+组织（OPEC+）7月份决定提高产量。【原文：Oil prices rose on Thursday after a U.S. court blocked President Donald Trump's tariffs from taking effect, while the market was watching out for potential new U.S. sanctions curbing Russian crude flows and an OPEC+ decision on hiking output in July.】

item.title: 美国关税抵消强劲芯片需求，韩国 5 月出口预计下降
item.description: 路透社周四的一项民意调查显示，由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普征收关税的影响抵消了对半导体的强劲需求，韩国5月份的出口预计将出现四个月来的首次下降。【原文：South Korea's exports are expected to have fallen in May for the first time in four months, as the impact of U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs offset strong demand for semiconductors, a Reuters poll showed on Thursday.】

item.title: 纽约时报》报道：美国暂停向中国飞机制造商中国商飞出售部分美国技术
item.description: 据《纽约时报》周三报道，美国已暂停向中国出售美国的一些关键技术，包括向中国国有航空航天制造商中国商飞公司出售与喷气发动机有关的技术。【原文：The United States has suspended some sales to China of critical U.S. technologies, including those related to jet engines to Chinese state-owned aerospace manufacturer COMAC, the New York Times reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 新西兰乳品公司恒天然上调年度利润预期，股价上涨
item.description: 新西兰恒天然集团（Fonterra）周四上调了其年度盈利预期的下限，此前该公司公布的第三季度利润有所增长，这主要得益于乳业巨头配料渠道和消费者运营业务的强劲表现。【原文：New Zealand's Fonterra raised the lower end of its annual earnings forecast on Thursday, after reporting higher third-quarter profit, helped by strength in the dairy giant's ingredients channel and consumer operations business.】

item.title: 波音公司首席执行官告诉《航空周刊》，波音的目标是在年底前认证 737 MAX 变体
item.description: 波音公司首席执行官凯利-奥特伯格（Kelly Ortberg）周三在接受行业刊物《航空周刊》（Aviation Week）采访时表示，波音公司预计将在今年年底前完成其最畅销的737 MAX系列飞机的认证工作。【原文：Boeing expects to finish certification of its best-selling 737 MAX family by the end of the year, CEO Kelly Ortberg said in an interview with trade publication Aviation Week published on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国法院阻止特朗普征收关税后美元反弹
item.description: 在法院阻止唐纳德-特朗普总统征收所谓的 "解放日 "进口关税后，美元周四大幅反弹，尤其是对欧元、日元和瑞士法郎的汇率飙升。【原文：The U.S. dollar rallied sharply on Thursday after a court blocked President Donald Trump from imposing his so-called Liberation Day import tariffs, with the currency surging against the euro, yen and Swiss franc in particular.】

item.title: VIEW 市场欢呼法院裁决阻止特朗普加征关税
item.description: 周四，在美国联邦法院阻止唐纳德-特朗普总统的 "解放日 "关税生效后，美国股指期货跳涨，美元兑日元和瑞郎等避险货币上涨。【原文：U.S. stock futures jumped and the dollar gained against safe-haven peers including the yen and Swiss franc on Thursday, after a U.S. federal court blocked President Donald Trump's "Liberation Day" tariffs from going into effect.】

item.title: 特朗普关税遭遇法庭障碍，亚洲股市反弹
item.description: 在美国联邦法院阻止唐纳德-特朗普总统的 "解放日 "关税生效后，周四亚洲股市和华尔街期货攀升，美元在避险货币的推动下上涨。【原文：Asian shares and Wall Street futures climbed in Asia on Thursday after a U.S. federal court blocked President Donald Trump's "Liberation Day" tariffs from going into effect, sending the dollar up on safe haven currencies.】

item.title: 雪佛龙将在得克萨斯州裁员近 800 人
item.description: 雪佛龙周三向德克萨斯州劳动力委员会（Texas Workforce Commission）发出通知，称将在德克萨斯州裁员近 800 人，这也是这家美国石油生产商计划在 2026 年底前裁减全球 20% 员工的一部分。【原文：Chevron will lay off nearly 800 employees in Texas, according to a notice on Wednesday to the Texas Workforce Commission, part of the U.S. oil producer's plan to cut up to 20% of its global workforce by the end of 2026.】

item.title: 美国法院阻止特朗普征收 "解放日 "关税
item.description: 美国一家联邦法院周三阻止了唐纳德-特朗普总统的 "解放日 "关税生效，裁定总统越权对来自向美国销售多于购买的国家的进口商品征收全面关税。【原文：A U.S. federal court on Wednesday blocked President Donald Trump's "Liberation Day" tariffs from going into effect, ruling that the president overstepped his authority by imposing across-the-board duties on imports from nations that sell more to the United States than they buy.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，派拉蒙出价 1500 万美元和解哥伦比亚广播公司诉讼案
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周三报道，派拉蒙全球公司与美国总统唐纳德-特朗普就解决他对哥伦比亚广播公司新闻（CBS News）的诉讼进行了一个月的谈判，但双方在条件上仍有很大分歧。【原文：A month into negotiations between Paramount Global and U.S. President Donald Trump to settle his lawsuit against CBS News, the parties remain far apart on terms, The Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: Kaiser Permanente 表示其网络正面临间歇性中断
item.description: 医疗保健集团凯撒医疗集团（Kaiser Permanente）周三表示，该公司正面临间歇性网络中断，影响到其多个系统，包括电子健康记录和病人服务。【原文：Healthcare conglomerate Kaiser Permanente said on Wednesday it is facing intermittent network disruptions affecting several of its systems, including electronic health records and patient services.】

item.title: 中国机器人出租车制造商进军热情洋溢的海湾地区，海外雄心日益壮大
item.description: 如果你是一家中国的机器人出租车公司，海湾地区已经成为你的首选之地，因为这里的监管环境正在接受这种技术，而且对乘车服务的需求也很旺盛。【原文：If you're a Chinese robotaxi company, the Gulf has become the place to be, attractive for a regulatory environment that is embracing the technology and robust demand for ride-hailing services.】

item.title: 美国联邦贸易委员会将要求 Synopsys 和 Ansys 剥离部分资产以解决合并问题
item.description: 美国联邦贸易委员会周三表示，将要求两家软件公司（Synopsys 和 Ansys）剥离某些资产，以解决围绕其 350 亿美元合并案的反垄断问题。【原文：The U.S. Federal Trade Commission said on Wednesday it will require two software companies —Synopsys and Ansys — to divest certain assets to resolve antitrust concerns surrounding their $35 billion merger.】
